com.st.st25sdk.command

Class Type5MemoryCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.st.st25sdk.command.Iso15693Protocol
      • com.st.st25sdk.command.Type5MemoryCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Type5MemoryCommandInterface

    public class Type5MemoryCommand
extends Iso15693Protocol
implements Type5MemoryCommandInterface
    The Type5MemoryCommand class implements some high level methods such as : the readBlocks/Bytes() and writeBlocks/Bytes() methods of Iso15693Command for Iso15693 tags whatever the tag memory size

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private int getReadMultipleBlockMaxLengthInBlocks(int blockSize) 
      private boolean isReadMultipleBlockSupported() 
      private boolean isWriteMultipleBlockSupported() 
      ReadBlockResult readBlocks(int firstBlockAddress, int sizeInBlocks)
      High level blocks read function for Type5 tags This function allows to read several blocks The function uses readMultipleBlock or readSingleBlock commands depending on memory addresses to be read
      ReadBlockResult readBlocks(int firstBlockAddress, int sizeInBlocks, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      High level blocks read function for Type5 tags This function allows to read several blocks The function uses readMultipleBlock or readSingleBlock commands depending on memory addresses to be read If the option bit is set on the flag parameter, the ReadBlockResult is filled with the blockSecurityStatus byte value for each read block
      byte[] readBytes(int byteAddress, int sizeInBytes)
      High level bytes read function for Type5 tags This function allows to read one or more bytes even if they are not in the same block
      byte[] readBytes(int byteAddress, int sizeInBytes, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      High level bytes read function for Type5 tags This function allows to read one or more bytes even if they are not in the same block If the option bit is set on the flag parameter, readBytes() will ignore it.
      private byte[] readMultipleBlock(int blockOffset, int nbrOfBlocks, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Read Multiple Block function managing Extended address format if needed Including blockOffset and nbrOfBlocks parameters as integer values blockOffset integer value will be translated as 1 byte or 2-byte array value to be used with readMultipleBlock or extendedReadMultipleBlock functions nbrOfBlocks integer value will be translated as a byte value to be used with readMultipleBlock function
      byte[] readSingleBlock(int blockOffset, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      High level Read Single Block function managing Extended address format if needed Including blockOffset parameter as integer value blockOffset integer value will be translated as 1 byte or 2-byte array value to be used with readSingleBlock or extendedReadSingleBlock functions
      private byte[] readSingleBlocks(int blockOffset, int nbrOfBlocks, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Function reading some blocks by calling single block commands
      void setFlag(byte flag)
      Method to define default request flag value
      void setTagMaxReadMultipleBlockLength(int tagMaxReadMultipleBlockLength)
      Set the maximum number of blocks that can be read with a single readMultipleBlock command
      void writeBlocks(int firstBlockAddress, byte[] data)
      High level blocks write function for Type5 tags This function allows to write several blocks
      void writeBlocks(int firstBlockAddress, byte[] data, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      High level blocks write function for Type5 tags This function allows to write several blocks
      void writeBytes(int byteAddress, byte[] data)
      High level byte write function for Type5 tags This function allows to write one or more bytes inside blocks even if they are not in the same block The function reads the blocks to be modify, change the bytes to be written then write the blocks
      void writeBytes(int byteAddress, byte[] data, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      High level byte write function for Type5 tags This function allows to write one or more bytes inside blocks even if they are not in the same block The function reads the blocks to be modify, change the bytes to be written then write the blocks
      private byte writeMultipleBlock(int blockOffset, int nbrOfBlocks, byte[] buffer, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Write Multiple Block function managing Extended address format if needed Including blockOffset parameter as integer value blockOffset integer value will be translated as 1 byte 2-byte array value to be used with writeMultipleBlock or extendedWriteMultipleBlock functions
      byte writeSingleBlock(int blockOffset, byte[] buffer, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Write Single Block function managing Extended address format if needed Including blockOffset parameter as integer value blockOffset integer value will be translated as 1 byte 2-byte array value to be used with writeSingleBlock or extendedWriteSingleBlock functions
      private void writeSingleBlocks(int blockOffset, int nbrOfBlocks, byte[] buffer, byte flag, byte[] uid)
      Function writing some blocks by calling single block commands

        public ReadBlockResult readBlocks(int firstBlockAddress,
                                  int sizeInBlocks)
                           throws STException
        High level blocks read function for Type5 tags This function allows to read several blocks The function uses readMultipleBlock or readSingleBlock commands depending on memory addresses to be read
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        firstBlockAddress - Address of the first block to read
        sizeInBlocks - Number of blocks to be read

      • readBlocks

        public ReadBlockResult readBlocks(int firstBlockAddress,
                                  int sizeInBlocks,
                                  byte flag,
                                  byte[] uid)
                           throws STException
        High level blocks read function for Type5 tags This function allows to read several blocks The function uses readMultipleBlock or readSingleBlock commands depending on memory addresses to be read If the option bit is set on the flag parameter, the ReadBlockResult is filled with the blockSecurityStatus byte value for each read block
        Specified by:
        readBlocks in interface Type5MemoryCommandInterface
        Parameters:
        firstBlockAddress - Address of the first block to read
        sizeInBlocks - Number of blocks to be read
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        read blocks
        Throws:
        STException

      • readBytes

        public byte[] readBytes(int byteAddress,
                        int sizeInBytes,
                        byte flag,
                        byte[] uid)
                 throws STException
        High level bytes read function for Type5 tags This function allows to read one or more bytes even if they are not in the same block If the option bit is set on the flag parameter, readBytes() will ignore it. To read the BSS byte, use readBlocks() instead.
        Specified by:
        readBytes in interface Type5MemoryCommandInterface
        Parameters:
        byteAddress - Address of the first byte to read
        sizeInBytes - Number of bytes to be read
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        read bytes
        Throws:
        STException

      • writeBytes

        public void writeBytes(int byteAddress,
                       byte[] data)
                throws STException
        High level byte write function for Type5 tags This function allows to write one or more bytes inside blocks even if they are not in the same block The function reads the blocks to be modify, change the bytes to be written then write the blocks
        Specified by:
        writeBytes in interface Type5MemoryCommandInterface
        Parameters:
        byteAddress - Address of the first byte to update
        data - Data to be update

      • readSingleBlock

        public byte[] readSingleBlock(int blockOffset,
                              byte flag,
                              byte[] uid)
                       throws STException
        High level Read Single Block function managing Extended address format if needed Including blockOffset parameter as integer value blockOffset integer value will be translated as 1 byte or 2-byte array value to be used with readSingleBlock or extendedReadSingleBlock functions
        Parameters:
        blockOffset - address of the block to be read (integer)
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • readMultipleBlock

        private byte[] readMultipleBlock(int blockOffset,
                                 int nbrOfBlocks,
                                 byte flag,
                                 byte[] uid)
                          throws STException
        Read Multiple Block function managing Extended address format if needed Including blockOffset and nbrOfBlocks parameters as integer values blockOffset integer value will be translated as 1 byte or 2-byte array value to be used with readMultipleBlock or extendedReadMultipleBlock functions nbrOfBlocks integer value will be translated as a byte value to be used with readMultipleBlock function
        Parameters:
        blockOffset - address of the block to be read (integer)
        nbrOfBlocks - Number of blocks to be read
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • writeSingleBlock

        public byte writeSingleBlock(int blockOffset,
                             byte[] buffer,
                             byte flag,
                             byte[] uid)
                      throws STException
        Write Single Block function managing Extended address format if needed Including blockOffset parameter as integer value blockOffset integer value will be translated as 1 byte 2-byte array value to be used with writeSingleBlock or extendedWriteSingleBlock functions
        Parameters:
        blockOffset - address of the block to be written (integer)
        buffer - Data to write
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • writeMultipleBlock

        private byte writeMultipleBlock(int blockOffset,
                                int nbrOfBlocks,
                                byte[] buffer,
                                byte flag,
                                byte[] uid)
                         throws STException
        Write Multiple Block function managing Extended address format if needed Including blockOffset parameter as integer value blockOffset integer value will be translated as 1 byte 2-byte array value to be used with writeMultipleBlock or extendedWriteMultipleBlock functions
        Parameters:
        blockOffset - address of the block to be read (integer)
        nbrOfBlocks - Number of blocks to be written
        buffer - Data to write
        flag - Request flag for the command
        uid - Tag's UID (used only if the Addressed mode bit is set in the request flag)
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException
